@olegmoz I don't see the utility of these tests; we are not assuring that the exception was logged. How about:
- extract the private log method to a new class (see above)
- make this class receive a `writer`
- execute the `LoggingSlice`with error and check if the error log was appended to the writer

replies.bodyText:
@paulodamaso I do not agree that these tests are useless, it is important that errors are not getting consumed by this slice. Though that's true, that main functionality of this class is not tested. There was discussion about it when this class was first created, and we agreed that testing it does not worth the effort of mocking logging system.
Also providing the logging method in constructor will make usage of this class harder. That is why logging is done by static methods everywhere.
replies.author: olegmoz

thrown when an error or other exception is encountered in the course of completing a result or task

But this throwable can be propagated from underlying slice error.
